Reviews.Title: “Great room, great location”
Reviews.Author: Hopstepper
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for one night on business. I got the room with access to the terrace ("guests are advised to not talk while on the terrace after 10pm") but it was too cold to use. The bed was a king size and comfortable, there's lot's of room. The bathroom is also big. There are lots of bars cafes and restaurants nearby with the Cricketer Bar just over the road. The wifi is free too.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel for visiting Paris”
Reviews.Author: Razzor9000
Reviews.Content: The Location is great. Near the Opera and 3 metro stations. around there are also a lot of restaurants. The Hotel itself was really nice. The room was small but beautiful and looked exactly like on their website(what is often not the case) We had breakfast included which was really good. The staff was very friendly. I definetly recommend this hotel for a visit of paris.

Reviews.Title: “OK- nice room, quiet but awful breakfast”
Reviews.Author: RMPS01
Reviews.Content: OK- nice room, quiet but awful breakfast liked the room, lots of privacy, quite small hotel, hard to find! in the middle of lots of little streets, nice staff, nice reception, cute DISGUSTING BREAKFAST- no sausages, bacon , pancakes, eggs NOTHING just bread(not toasted) boring yoghurts salami and some staleish pastries. wouldn;t come again but wouldnt discourage unless you love breakfast....

Reviews.Title: “Convenience and luxury”
Reviews.Author: Penny G
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Sydney Opera for seven nights in October 2011 following several weeks in Europe. We were apprehensive, to say the least, after staying in another name brand hotel in Rome. However, we couldn't have been more pleasantly surprised. The room was very modern, exceptionally clean and a good size with plenty of space for suitcases and lots of cupboards. The bathroom was large compared to others with a full bath and both rooms had windows overlooking the street which we left open each night to allow for fresh air. And what really surprised and pleased us was an electric jug in our room which allowed us to make cups of tea and coffee, a luxury in European hotels it seems. The continental breakfast was amongst the best we had experience during our entire stay and the staff were friendly and helpful. The hotel is centrally located enabling us to walk to all major attractions. It is a five minute walk to the railway station and a five minute walk to the hop-on hop-off bus. It is also a five minute walk from some of the best shopping we've seen. We truly enjoyed our stay in this wonderful hotel and would definitely stay there again should the opportunity arise.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value for money paid.”
Reviews.Author: Eugene K
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 2 nights in October 2011 and were pleasantly surprised. Great location, close to metro and in walking distance to Louvre and Champs Elysee. Roissy airport bus stop around 500 metres away. Reception staff friendly and helpful (didn't charge us for a water taken from mini bar as we didnt have the right change). Room small but sufficient, bathroom and toilet a bit dated but fine. We only had a little problem with the room temperature which we thought was a bit too low. Breakfast in hotel lobby was quite good and the service staff was polite and quick. However tables are very small and limited in number.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay”
Reviews.Author: Geanne_54
Reviews.Content: We stayed 5 nights at this hotel in May. It is well located, within walking distance to main attractions and stores along Boulevard Haussman. Our room was bright and spotlessly clean. The buffet breakfast included baguettes, croissants, a selection of cheeses and jams, yogurts, fruit salad, eggs and custard. There is a computer in the lobby where there are lots of newspapers and magazines for guests to read. The front desk staff was polite and helpful. Would definitely go back. We recommend the chinese restaurant in the Galeries Lafayette nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Great accommodation”
Reviews.Author: oldbluebagfaithful
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located in central Paris & close to all the tourist sites. We stayed in room 307 which appeared to be recently renovated & in good condition. It was spacious by Paris standards, had a king size bed, bathroom with a separate toilet & a window with flower box - very french!! The room was well serviced daily. The staff on the front desk - Anna & Daisy were extremely helpful with directions & advice. I would recommend this hotel & would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “We loved it and can't wait to come back!”
Reviews.Author: jjbirish
Reviews.Content: Service was excellent, especially Daisy and Karim at the reception desk! Room was small but more than adequate. The hotel was in a perfect location to access Hop On Hop Off Bus to all tourist attractions. Exellent continental breakfast and internet access made our stay complete! The only drawback was the elevator which was rather small - not for the claustrophobic! Overall a wonderful experience!

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay in Paris”
Reviews.Author: Jon T
Reviews.Content: The hotel was very clean and comfortable. The room felt like a little Parisian loft studio apartment. Breakfast was very good. There were breads, croissants, ham, and cheese. In addition they had a breakfast custard and allowed you to hard or soft boil your own eggs. The hotel staff was polite and accommodating. When their hot water heater went out over the weekend they offered to put us up in another hotel around the corner, but we liked the hotel so much that we decided to stay put and we had enough hot water the whole time.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our stay!”
Reviews.Author: ritz89
Reviews.Content: This was a great experience. I had read reviews that were good on TripAdvisor and after a lot of research booked the hotel. It was a good stay and everything was pleasant. Daisy at the concierge desk was always pleasant and arranged for our tours. Breakfast was very good and I would recommend this property to anyone..location wise it was on Rue de Matherins - 15 minutes walk from Rue de Rivoli and about 25 minute walk from Champs Elysees.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: akspink
Reviews.Content: Very convenient for walking and sightseeing in Paris. Excellent service and very high standard of cleanliness and comfort. Staff were very helpful and pleasant. Breakfasts were excellent. A delightful hotel, and we enjoyed our three nights there, which were too short. I recommend this hotel to anyone wishing to stay in Paris and hope to return there myself in the next year or so.

Reviews.Title: “Thoroughly recommended”
Reviews.Author: saintgerry
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 4 nights and did not have any complaints. The girls on the front desk were excellent, the location is great and the rooms were big enough for the two of us and cleaned everyday. Breakfast is buffet style and you can have as much as you like. There is a metro station within a couple of minutes walk and there are many restuarants nearby. We found a little chinese restuarant on Rue D'Arcade which serves fantastic meals at decent prices

Reviews.Title: “We recomend this hotel in Paris!”
Reviews.Author: PerHalvard
Reviews.Content: It is a quiet area, but the windows in the rooms is still low noise so you do not hear any traffic. The staff are friendly, helpful and honest. When we left, we had forgotten a bottle in the minibar. Maid was honest and came after us with this. Modern and cozy rooms with great bathrooms. Free wifi. The hotel looks frech and has no bad smell. The bar is closed, but the staff makes drinks for you if you ask for it. We slept well and had a very good stay. Only thing that does not make the top score is that breakfast was expensive, but there are good alternatives to the nearest street.

Reviews.Title: “excellent location ,friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: asa6
Reviews.Content: extremely well located to the massive number of metro stations in Paris and very affordable also. extremely friendly and helpful staff made our stay all the more pleasant being far from fluent in French language. Clean rooms , far from large in size but par for the course in Europe. would recommend this Hotel

Reviews.Title: “Good Location and Spacious”
Reviews.Author: winnie001
Reviews.Content: My spouse and I travelled to Paris. We moved from Versailles to central Paris. As the accomodation in Versailles was really small, so it was quite a welcome for us to be able to have such a spacious room. The hotel is strategically located with Gallery Lafayette just round the corner.. The room is clean and the breakfast is quite a nice spread for Paris standard..

Reviews.Title: “Excellent choice !!”
Reviews.Author: SaGallo
Reviews.Content: Hotel perfeito: Café da Manha delicioso: manteiga, requeijão , 3 tipos de queijo , presunto, iorgute, chocolate, café, sucos!!! Quarto: cama ótima, banheiro novo com secador, tem uma area extra na sacada com mesa e cadeira Localização : melhor impossível na rua muito perto da lafayete. Opera. Saint-honore. Igreja madeleide. Acesso a 3 metros muito próximos. Atendimento: todos são amáveis e fazem de tudo para ajudar vc. Meu marido machucou o joelho, eles deram gelo, gazes, curativos!!! Muito amável !!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location-Thanks Daisy and staff of this charming hotel!”
Reviews.Author: QueensRocks
Reviews.Content: Two parents, two teenage daughters-first time for the girls in the City of Light. We orignally booked through a travel agent for the hotel across the street. When we arrived the room wasn't ready and the staff were rude and wouldn't give us anywhere to clean up and store our bags while we went out for the day. I work in a four-star hotel in NYC and this is NOT the way to welcome your guests. We called our travel agent in the USA and he moved us immediately across the street to the BW, which was more our speed. The breakfast was included and I must say I never needed more than they gave me. The lobby has a nice selection of newspapers (USA,UK, France, Spanish) and if you're the first one ready for the day, you can wait for the others and catch up on the local news. The most invaluable asset of the hotel was Daisy, a friendly and very knowledgeable lady at the front desk. She's worked there for years and gave our family great advice on the essentials of the city. She explained the Metro to us, knew store hours, and recommended nice places to eat. We would never have found so much in such a short time without her. Great job Daisy, you have made the journeys of many people so meaningful. Thanks for being a great ambassador for your city!

Reviews.Title: “Pleased with this wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: worldaviator
Reviews.Content: My partner and I booked this last minute room on Best Western's website. Near the metro stop Saint Augustine, we were checked in by a very nice lady (Anna). We booked a twin but got a triple on the 4th floor and the room was huge! Very charming too. The bathroom had a modern bathtub, with great water pressure, and a spacious sink for putting our toiletries. The beds were comfortable, and our room had 2 televisions. The complimentary wi-fi from our floor worked well as well. The only issue was this "beeping noise" that would go off every now and then, in our rooms and apparently in the hallway. This sound must be some detection of a person walking around, I assume. The breakfast was wonderful as was the lady who worked at the breakfast room. All in all, we were pleased to stay in this BW hotel in the 9th arrondisement. We're not fans of being close to major shopping like Printemps, but the area has some great restaurants that are not too far from the hotel. A plus... a pharmacy is next door to the hotel. Overall, thanks to the hotel staff for a wonderful 1 night stay at BW Sydney Opera.

Reviews.Title: “Well Located”
Reviews.Author: OuzoandCoke
Reviews.Content: Stayed there for 5 nights on the strength of personal recommendations and Trip Advisor reviews. We arrived from London by Eurostar at Gard du Nord train station and got a cab to the hotel for 18euros I think. It's located in a backstreet away from noise yet only a minute or two from shopping and restaurants. Hotel was clean and room was a good size with a fridge, tea making facilities and an electronic safe. We also had a bath. The continental breakfast was simple but plentiful and the breads and pastries superb. Staff were fantastic, particularly Anna and Daisy at reception who also speak pretty good English. If you're used to walking then this hotel is within reach of most of the major attractions however the Latin Quarter on the south bank and the Eiffel Tower take a bit of reaching by foot and so maybe a bit onerous for some. The hop-on-hop-off bus could be an alternative. We also booked a tour package through City Discovery Tours encompassing dinner at the Eiffel Tower followed by a Seine River cruise then onto the Moulin Rouge show and it was sensational, all for a fraction of the cost had we booked each one individually. Well worth it! A very pleasant stay and will book the hotel again when next in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ashleytang
Reviews.Content: I stayed there for 8 nights in early October for Fashion Week and was pleasantly surprised. The room was large, the bathroom equally spacious. Having stayed in Paris many times before, I would say it was this hotel is excellent for its price category. I didn't experience any of the discomforts of the previous guests. The only thing that would require improvement would be the breakfast selection but other that that, I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “OK but renovations were unfortunate”
Reviews.Author: morris-travella
Reviews.Content: We stayed here under advise from my wife's work mate but wish we had stayed elsewhere. It was unfortunate that they are having renovations which meant lots of noise first thing in the morning, no aircon and breakfast only in the room. We arrived on a Sunday and after booking a delux room got into room 306 which would be no more than 3.5m x 3.5m and by the time you have a king size bed, desk and wardrobe, not much room for anything else. I don't care what others say, you can spend a bit of time in your room and its nice to have space not eating breakfast while sitting on your bed. The bathroom ceiling was so low, I am 6'5" or 196cm and couldn't stand up in the bath while having a shower and of course the shower rose is lower again, this is not on so we thought a delux room is like this!!! Imagine what a standard room would be like. We complained and was told to wait till the manager got in the next day. After being awoke by hammering caused from the reno's at 7:30am, we had our breakfast on our bed and proceeded to the reception area to talk to the manager. She was polite and stated the room we were put in was not a delux room and go and check out a room on the 4th floor or room 504. Other alternatives was there is another best western hotel around the corner which seemed nicer but the rooms weren't much better so we opted for room 504 which was bigger and I could fit in the bath for a shower. Only trouble being, the smallest lift I have ever seen (4 people max and that would be a squeeze) only goes to the 4th floor then you have to climb the stairs to the 5th floor. We stayed 7 nights there and all the time I was cursing my wifes friend. Look we were warned on the size of rooms in europe so we were expecting a small room but for goodness sake, be warned. If you do intend to stay here, ask when the renovations will be finished and when is the aircon going to be working for I suspect with Summer coming along, it will get hot. If you open the window, then you here all the building works. The bed was comfy enough but we had no tea and coffee making facilities but one phone call fixed that. They have such small kettles that only boil enough for 2 cups of tea and take fore-ever to boil. The power point in the bathroom is goverend by the light switch. There is no free bottles of water but the tap water seemed ok to drink. The safe is not a keypad type but rather a unique key that you pay 50euro deposite for. Rm 504 has two seperate rooms with 2 TV's but if one wants to watch another channel, then there is no door to seperate the noise so it sort of defeats the purpose a little bit. While we were in the room one day around 4pm, had someone knock then open the door. When my wife said yes to them, we couldn't see them, they quickly shut the door. Made us a bit suspicious so don't leave any valuables lying around in the room. Breakfast is 13 euro which you fill out a form the night before. We saw people having breakfast in the reception area and the staff didn't seem to mind. We ate out for breakfast. There are plenty of places around and even a maccas about 10min walk away. Taxis are fairly cheap. 13 euro to the Eifel tower. The Hotel will book taxis for you and they were helful enough to confirm bookings we had made prior through viator. There is free internet but the PC blew up on the ast day we were there which was a pain for we wanted to checkin our flights. We did book through the hotel a dinner cruise on the seine. Take the 9pm one. It cost us 178 euro per couple. It was great. They ask for 30 euro deposite and you can request a table by the window. The food was devine and of course the scenery was electric especially when they take you past the tower. We ate at a Italian restaurant called Pompai which is turn left then take the first right. You will see the restaraunt up on the left. If you also turn left at the restaurant and walk about 50m, there is a small shop that sells fruit and softdrink , bickies and water etc. I think by memeory there is another shop further up that sells the same. Things to do. Make sure you book the fat bike paris tours. a 3 hour pushbike tour which was fantastic. Get Sadie as your guide she is fantastic and the tour is for all ages and very leisurely. If you do the night one aswell, you get it half price. We tried to go but was too stuffed to do it. If you want to get the hop on hop off bus, make sure you get the green one not the red one. I think Viator only do the red one. The reason being is that te green bus does the red buses route but stops 16 times against the red ones only 8 times which is a pain for some of the sights you wish to see, takes ages to walk to once you get off the red bus. Also the green bus does 3 other different routes here the red one only does the one route. The cost is the same. SCAM SCAM SCAM. I got caught at the eifel tower. A so called bosnian girl comes up to you and first asked if you speak English which I said I did then she shows me a card which said along the lines, my brother has leukemia and needs urgent medical treatment blah blah blah please give money so I gave her 1 euro in which she persisted for more so I took it back and got up and walked away. She pestered me and followed me saying she was sorry so I gave her the euro and off she went. Then another came up 5 mins later and another and another. Boy this brother has a lot of sisters!! Then I realised it is a scam for there were 10's of these girls working the tourist scene. Not only there but at the Arch de Truimphe (how ever you spell it) they were there too. In the end we told them to get a real job and stop scamming poeple. We even got approached while eating Maccas in the store. If you don't want to donate, just say no. They do walk off. Another con is a guy bends down in front to you and claims to have found a gold ring on the ground. If you take the ring, then they ask for a finders reward. I just said in my smart a--- voice, good luck to you mate and looked away. They soon walk off. There are the usual beggers begging for money while they wear their gap hats and smoke. Plenty of vendors selling miniture eifel towers.My wife bought one for 10euro but the starting price was 25 and in the shop it was 40 so we got a bargin but it probably cost 2 to make from chine!!!. Make sure if you buy one that it comes apart for easy storage. Make sure you buy your tickets to the eifel tower prior for the queues get really long unless you want to climb the stairs. If you get a ticket to the summit, you still have to queue on the 2nd floor to get up to te summit but it is well worth it. I loved the tower and could stare at it for ages. We booked a dinner at the tower and river cruise through Viator which was fantastic. The food was great on the 1st floor. You have the choice of what time to catch the boat so we waited till the 10pm cruise to catch all the building lights at night. Yes it is still light there after 10pm. There is also a cafe on the 1st floor so when we got kicked out of te restaurant, we went there. Louvre was ok.All we wanted to see was the mona lisa. Buy your ticket prior or in our case, we got the 2 day museum pass but don't queue at the pyrimid like everyone else, there are two other entrances that no-one queues in so if you look at the Louvre and have the pyramid in from of you, to your right hand side wing there is an entrance in which we walked straight in and within 10mins, was taking photos of the mona lisa. How simple was that. That info was thanks to Sadie doing the bike tour. If you go to Notre Damm, that is free enrty but the queue is long so we sneaked in through the exit door. We did two tours outside of Paris. One was to the Loiure valley and went to three Chalets which was great and the other was to the champagne region to visit G.H.MUMM and Moet & Chandon. Two great champagnes and lovey was in here element. We had 7 nights in Paris and loved it. Would I come back, you bet. Would I stay in the Hotel Sydney Opera, no I don't think so. If you want to ask anymore questions, please feel free to email me on ian.morris@nn.com.au. Have a great trip.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable Good Location”
Reviews.Author: STKIS
Reviews.Content: Friendly front desk staff. Room small but adequate. Air conditioning not working but a fan supplied and window was able to be opened at night. Unfortunately renovation taking place which were very noisy. We not able to have afternoon rest and the banging was continual. A pity we were not advised previously of this. Location great to many restaurants and shops. A 15 minute walk to Champs El Elysse. Aussie Traveller

Reviews.Title: “Don't understand the goods reviews”
Reviews.Author: SimpleN
Reviews.Content: I have minimal expectation and have stayed at various BW hotels in Paris. I know what to expect, small rooms and bathrooms. The location of the hotel is great, one reason I chose it, I even got upgraded arrival without request to a larger room. The problems with this particular one :- 1) dirty dust covered hangers on arrival. I just wanted to finish my unpacking and get some rest after a 22 hour trip. Not a problem and I just thought the hangers hadn't been used in a while. Nothing to complain about. 2) Breakfast room was being renovated and so all orders were room service. This equals luke warm coffee and only cold foods. 3)I only realized after day 3 that the that they were NOt vacuuming the rooms. You see some crumbs on the floor and think they must have missed a spot but after the 2nd day you realize that they are just not cleaning. If you serve food in the rooms I would assume you would need to vacuum very carefully. 4) the vacuum or cleaning bags were in the hallway the entire time. lack of tidiness for a hotel 5) general lack of cleanliness everywhere. They were renovation the ground floor and I am sure that dust and dirt may have contributed. In their defense, I did not bring these issues up when I was staying there. I was on a work trip and use the limited room time to do my work. When you have a short trip, you just don't want the hassels of making complaints. However, I do think it is managements responsibility to check on rooms ect. and maintain standards. When the guest complains it is too late. BTW there is great free WIFI which worked well. Front desk were nice.

Reviews.Title: “No Complaints”
Reviews.Author: CatwomanAustralia
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel and we are very happy with the service it is very central, and the staff at the reception and the breakfast room are very helpful.The rooms are okay and pretty clean.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, fantastic breakfasts, helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: MatureTravellersAus
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed for 4 nights over New Year in 2009. We had a ground floor room behind the dining area. The room was small but oh so comfortable and intimate. The hotel is so well located..the staff were very helpful, its location in the Opera district makes it a short walk to the main shopping area...the underground and most of the attractions are not that far away. We walked everywhere and would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel- warmly recommended”
Reviews.Author: lironavr
Reviews.Content: We had a lovely stay at this hotel. it is very well located, close to 3 metro stops (Madeleine, sant augustine and sant lazar), lots of restaurants and cafes, seems like a safe area (no immigrants, quiet streets). we walked almost everywhere. 15 minutes to placa de la concorde. galleries lafayete, opera house- within 5-10 minutes walk. if you like shopping it is a minute from haussman street which is full of fashion (and other) shops. the room was spacious, very clean. very big and comfortable bed. the bathroom a bit small, two people in it will feel a bit crowded, but it was clean and equiped and for us it was ok. there is airconditioning, mini bar, TV. very good room, relatively to Paris and also to other cities we have visited. the hotel in redecorating- which they don't tell you when you book it! there was no noise BUT the breakfast room is not operating and you get your breakfast to your room according to a list of foods you can choose from. it was a very good breakfast: croissants, baguettes, cheesses, yogurt, tea/coffee/chocolate, orange (and other) juice, fruit, cereals... very good food and selection ALTHOUGH it was supposed to be a buffet breakfast- which it is not- and if you want extra something you have to call reception which is very annoying. that was the main thing we disliked. reception staff very helpful and speak english. there is a computer with internet in the lobby. We loved Paris and would like to come back again, naturally... I would definatly stay here again and recommend to friends and family.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location !”
Reviews.Author: kolbach
Reviews.Content: We stayed on the second floor, a large room, king size bed and a single bed ( there was three of us ) We found the staff very friendly and helpful as our luggage was missing and they did all they could by contacting the Airline for us. The breakfast was great plenty to eat so no problems there. The hotel is so convenient to shops and Metro, and is walking distane to the Louve. My family and I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic little hotel with great staff and really great location”
Reviews.Author: TravellingMariner
Reviews.Content: Thanks to TripAdvisor, we avoided some real problems with a hotel in Paris for our first trip to France but had a problem finding anywhere for a weekend that was located centrally and yet reasonably priced. Finally tracked this place down on the internet and loved it. Location is ten minutes walk from Gare St Lazare, where the RER train from the airport took us. Fifteen minutes from Place de la Concorde and the Seine. Twnety minutes from Champs Elysee. Loads of local restaurants. Very comfortable, spotless room that have been recently renovated (ask for one overlooking the Rue du Mathurins with the lovely window boxes), really helpful bilingual staff for whom nothing is too much trouble. Very comprehensive buffet breakfast to fortify you for a day of trying to see all of Paris! This is a really great find, whether you are there for two days like us or longer.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel and service”
Reviews.Author: MaruMiami_Florida
Reviews.Content: this hotel was great for us. They helped us incredibly with an experience we went through when Air France lost my husband's wheelchair. They staff made phone calls for us and truly took this incident to heart. Karim is a young man with a great heart and really went out of his way to help us. i will be forever thankful for the service we received at this hotel. Will definitely go back whenever we visit Paris again!

Reviews.Title: “Charming”
Reviews.Author: abbagirl123
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nights while on our Paris trip. What attracted us was the free internet. The staff was very polite. The room was comfortable - the decor was a tad tacky - but we got a good deal, so you get what you pay for. The free breakfast was great - much better than american continental breakfasts. There was a selection of baked goods - croissants, pastries, etc.. Several beverages - teas, coffees, espresso, and juices (freshly squeezed and other). Cereals, fruit, a pot for boiling water for eggs. It was within a few blocks from the Metro, so that was convenient. A few downsides include: if you face the street - there is a bar right across the street and it can get noisy. We had to close the windows and it can get muggy (luckily it was September and the a/c worked fine). There was some sort of mix up when we checked in and apparently someone else mistakenly thought our room was their room, so we were startled at 12 midnight when the concierge opened up our door the first night while we were sleeping. I was startled and enfuriated, but I guess the woman who checked us in was busy doing other things and forgot to mark down we were registered. The next day, however, she apologized profusely and gave us two boxes of chocolates (not sure if that was enough though). But anyway, they tried.

Reviews.Title: “Good location but that's about it”
Reviews.Author: FabulousMom
Reviews.Content: If you just want a place to sleep in then this hotel may suit your needs. Don't expect good service from the receptionist/s. They speak minimal English, barely smiled and did not seem too happy to answer questions. Internet is free but it is difficult to access it from the room. The best place to use your laptop is in the lobby for a better signal. The rooms were clean but small (typical among European hotels, I gathered). The walls between the rooms were so thin that you can hear the people talking in the other rooms. Air conditioning was working well but the elevator was not (it kept breaking down). Location is quite good because it is very near Galleries Lafayette and Printemps. It is also possible to walk to the famous Rue Saint Honore and the Louvre from the hotel. There was a minimal selection of breads, orange juice, coffee or hot chocolate for breakfast which were quite adequate. Like I said earlier, if you just want a place to sleep in, this hotel is fine but don't expect anything more.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: HappyTravelerVan
Reviews.Content: We stayed for one week in September. We were given room 605. It is on the first floor. A large room with a king bed, nice size modern bathroom with tub. The room was tastefully decorated. The bonus of this room is it has it's own courtyard. The only room in the hotel with an outdoor space, it was great. Christal was great to us, very patient and super helpful. The other woman who works the front desk did seem frazzled at times. We loved the location of the hotel, so close to so much. We walked to many of the highlights of Paris and there were multiple metro lines within minutes of the hotel. Many choices for food and drink as well. I think we really lucked out with this hotel. We did not have the breakfast, it was very pricey and not included with the room. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good place - Small rooms - Front desk service could be improved”
Reviews.Author: Juliennoise
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Sydney Opera Hotel in August 2009. I often stay in Paris hotels when visiting family. The hotel is very clean. The staff helpful. The breakfast is plentiful with pastries, cereals, yogurt, hard boiled eggs etc. The rooms are small but well kept. I found the price to be a bit expensive for what you get. However, the low Canadian Dollar value could be the reason. For this price (in Canadian Dollar) we can stay at a Hilton or a Fairmont hotel in Canada where the services would be greater. The front desk staff is typically French in the quite poor quality of service i.e. slow and not very helpful. That being said, it is still a good hotel by Paris standards.

Reviews.Title: “Very Satiisfied, clean, pretty, nice staff, FREE WIFI, nice location”
Reviews.Author: NorthernVAJim
Reviews.Content: Really could not be happier with this hotel. It provides everything a traveler needs except a swimming pool (smile)! Attractive decor, nice & helpful desk staff, FREE WIFI that worked in rooms, too. Our room was small but so was the cost, relatively speaking. Bathroom small but spotless. I would return gladly. Nice location too.

Reviews.Title: “Ooh La La”
Reviews.Author: Sharon193
Reviews.Content: What a great little hotel. Paris is known for tiny rooms but we were pleasantly surprised as we had two rooms. The lift is the tiniest I have ever seen and it took two trips to get the luggage up but this quaintness appealed to us. The spiral staircase and Parisian decor gave it real character. Staff were very helpful and breakfast was great with those wonderful fresh baguettes. Location was within walking distance to everything including major attractions like the Louvre, Concord and Madeline. Lots of good restaurants in the immediate vicinity. (try Chez Papa for their wonderful hot salads). We would have no hesitation returning to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and price”
Reviews.Author: ignacio_ana
Reviews.Content: The best of this hotel is his great location close to Madelaine, Opera, Lafayette, etc. My room was really big compared with other Paris Hotels. All staff were very helpful. Breakfast wasnt very good, very little choice.

Reviews.Title: “the best paris hotel and location.”
Reviews.Author: Gunner10
Reviews.Content: This hotel was very enjoyable to stay at. The rooms are quite comfortable and spacious. The staff was very nice and helpful. It is located in very quite neighborhood. I thought it was a perfect location to all the great locations and sights. I recommend this great hotel to anyone who would be going to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “A gem in Paris only a walk to Printemps and metro.”
Reviews.Author: Travelpartner89
Reviews.Content: This charming hotel is on a street of shops and restaurants. It has a tiny elevator and stairs to floors of rooms. The second floor has only stairs but easily ascended with luggage. The first floor consists of a cozy lobby, bar and a breakfast room with a glass ceiling. From my bedroom I could see down into the breakfast room. Our room had a living room area and a separate area for the bed, night stands and a small chair. Windows provided cross breezes. The bath had a great tub as I love a bath. Not too many of those in hotels in Europe. For breakfast we had eggs, croissants, Danishes, breads, ham, turkey, cheeses, Nutella, jams, a variety of fresh and dried fruits, coffee, tea and juices. A plentiful fare that is included in the price of the hotel room. The staff is very helpful and friendly, always willing to answer questions and offer assistance in any way needed. I really enjoyed our stay here as I felt very much at home. I would stay here again. It is only a short walk to the metro and easy assess to restaurants and shopping.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, terrific staff, decent breakfast”
Reviews.Author: ziggysmum
Reviews.Content: We bought a package which included Hotel Sydney Opera and several tours. After three weeks travelling through France staying in an odd assortment of hotels this one was a very pleasant surprise. The room, while of course not large (this is Paris after all!) was quite OK and the bathroom was clean and bigger than many we'd seen. You have to pay 50 euros deposit for the key to the safe, but it's refundable so that's OK. The staff were terrific, very helpful, spoke good English, always friendly. The continental breakfast was quite good, again compared with others we'd been offered. And you could have hot tea, which is a big plus in Europe, it's usually served lukewarm. There's only one small elevator in our section but it wasn't a problem, it's a small hotel and we never had to wait for it.

Reviews.Title: “Good location with pleasant rooms”
Reviews.Author: Tripplanner-89
Reviews.Content: Spent four nights at the Sydney Opera and would recommend it for anyone wanting a small property with great service. The desk staff were great in answering my often strange questions. One afternoon a member of the staff actually walked me up a block or more to show me a restaurant I seemed unable to find on my own ( two locations with the same street number, go figure it,s Paris!) Hotel is a short walk from the nearby RER station. Also located near several Metro lines depending on which direction you headed. If shopping is your desire both Printemps and Galeries Lafayette are also near. Walk to the Place De La Concorde and pass La Madeleine on the way if you like to walk (we do). Rooms can be a bit small (we had a sitting room included by some dumb luck) but they are clean and quite comfortable. Our bothroom was not large but we had no problems with facilities and it was always clean. Take care to get an upper floor/or inside room as an Aussie bar across the street can be a noise problem later at night. The breakfast room was not real large but we never had a problem with seating. Great selection of food including a strange system of cooking your own soft/hard boiled eggs, which does seem to work satisfactorily. Great ham along with different cheese. Rolls, chocolate croissants, croissants and tea cakes to fill the bread board. Good fresh orange juice to start the day. A good family location.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly, helpful staff.”
Reviews.Author: Dianne017
Reviews.Content: As you don't get much for your money as far as Paris hotels go, or is that just me (Australian dollars after all!!!!) this hotel was perfect. Great location at an affordable price. The staff greeted you at alltimes of the day and arranged anything you needed and promptly too. Close to the department stores. We took the Roissy bus from CDG as I had read in many reviews. It cost about 35 euros for three people and dropped you off a couple of blocks away. The hotel arranged the yellow airport shuttle company for our return to CDG and at 51 euros for door to door it was worth the extra. My suggestion would be to email the hotel and have them arrange this for your arrival too. The Roissy bus was packed to over capacity in my opinion and luggage racks were piled high and it was dangerous! Not to mention there was standing room only therefore I didn't think worth the money. I would definately stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location, great rooms, filling breakfast and very helpful staff!”
Reviews.Author: Global-Trekker7
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for four night in April 2009 with my wife, brother and parents during a 17 day European family vacation. The location is perfect, with just a few minutes walk to several metro stations and train station. It is tucked away on a quiet street, close to PrinTemps department store and several great restaurants - Chez Papa. The rooms were comfortable, very clean and spacious compared to other European accommodations I have experienced. The breakfast was wonderful with meats, cheeses, breads yogurt and Parisian coffee. The staff was extremely helpful and provided fantastic dinner recommendations each night. Additionally, the staff mailed me my drivers license, after leaving it behind in the room, and it actually beat me home. Thank you to the staff! I would recommend this location to any traveler and would further recommended the duck dinner at Chez Papa, which is about two minutes away.

Reviews.Title: “Quality service and good price”
Reviews.Author: Ine_PR
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the Sydney Opera on May 2008 during my first visit to Paris and Europe. I chose it after reading lots of reviews here in TA. When we arrived, the hotel looked just as the pictures in the web, very clean and elegant. The service was very good, the room was cleaned everyday ( I stayed 4days) and it was very quiet during the night. The breakfast was included in the rate and it was good, not too fancy but Ok to start the day. I liked the WiFi in the lounge, and it was free. It is very close to Opera Garnier, but I found it a little hard to reach it by subway from the airport, maybe due to my inexperience. In the area of the Opera Garnier you can take the hop on/hop off bus, which takes you all around Paris and is a great way to get to the main attractions. I also took a night cruise in the Seine River and it was GREAT. All in all, i think it is a good hotel, good price and good rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Well kept secret”
Reviews.Author: guyb6489
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at this hotel for 5 nights in September. The hotel had been recently renovated and it showed in the general presentation. The room was not large but ample for the two of us with twin beds which is quite common in Europe. Not hard to push together. The bathroom again was small but had a bath with shower over with marble tiling and vanity. Both areas were spotlessly clean and maintained that way for the duration of our stay. Everyone associated with the hotel were always polite and extremely helpfull. The breakfast area and buffet breakfast were some of the best we encounted in our travels. We had a front room on the third floor which had french windows overlooking the street scene because of the effective soundproofing when the windows were closed there was no noise inside the room. The air conditioning worked and was silent in operation. The location of the hotel was extremely convenient being only a short walk from the major shopping areas, most of the sites of Paris, the underground rail network and also cllose to Gare du Nord rail station.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant, Central and Quaint”
Reviews.Author: Verve_M
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 9 days over April and May, and very much enjoyed our stay. The Hotel is close enough to the Metro and in walking distance from the major department stores. The room was excellent because it had a little lounge or 3rd bed area, with second tv, and just added that extra for us to crash on return from walking tours. There was a little bit of thumping from above, so I would take the 4th floor next time. The room was always spotlessly cleaned, and the service was fine. The breakfast was great, with plenty of variety and always stocked up. We found the staff very patient, especially when some of the fellow guests didnt seem to know how to self-serve (poaching the eggs in the boiling water for the hard boiled eggs seemed to be one of the more bizarre rituals!!) Lots of Australians are here (could be the name!) and this may or may not put you off. We had a lovely stay and would very much recommend this place.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service”
Reviews.Author: Wallytheaussie
Reviews.Content: Two adults and our son of 11 spent 7 nights at this hotel. We were on the 4th Floor, the lift was out of action and renovations were happening on the 2nd Floor. You might think a recipe for disaster? Not so. Our room was fine for Paris, a triple, odd configuration, but warm and comfortable. Good comfy beds, two LCD Tv's (keep the young one happy at night) a small but well configured bathroom,mini bar and everything worked. Importantly a very clean hotel, no smoke smell (we had a smoking room) and a pleasant bar area and retreat downstairs after a long day touring. (nice french champagne available). The service made the difference. Try getting laundry done in Paris, three days if you are lucky. The hotel doesn't offer this service either but the reception staff collected and delivered our laundry while we were away, asking for nothing in return. They also provided a discounted rate for the room because of the lift failure and offered us accomodation on a lower floor. Breakfast we didn't use as it was a bit expensive but there are plenty of cafes close by. Close to some reasonable restaurants and public transport. We have very fond memories of this hotel. OK for families, maybe not the aged until the lift is fixed.

Reviews.Title: “B & B + Your Favorite Hotel = Hotel Sydney Opera!”
Reviews.Author: madrid_earth_angel
Reviews.Content: From the very beginning, my partner and I knew our trip would be Paris on the cheap. Winter in Paris meant lower plane fare, beautiful weather, not too many tourists. Through emails, the Hotel Sydney of the Bestwestern chain was a great help. Take the Roissy Bus, they wrote, it's only 8 euro, while a taxi would have set us back 40+ euro. And so we did, and were dropped off a block and a half away. Fresh off the bus, we called the front desk--how do we get to your hotel? They guided us through, and we were at our hotel in 2 minutes! Fantastic. Breakfast is your typical assortment of French pastries, jams, eggs you boil according to preference, ham, cheeses, coffee, fresh fruit juices. And those lovely croissants--I just miss those! The lift can fit a total of 3 guys I guess, but we preferred to take the stairs anyway, it's padded with red carpet, and feels like you're in someone's house, which incidentally, the hotel used to be. Our room had a window facing the courtyard, and we'd open the window to enjoy the cold coming in while snuggled up in our coziest of beds, in our coziest of rooms! An added bonus would be the strong wi-fi in our room--the boyfriend would even download movies while we were out. The only hitches, though I don't even consider them hitches, would be the non-availability of an adapter at the front desk, and the absence of a safe in our room (for a deposit of 50 euro, you could leave your valuables at the front desk's safe). But overall, this was one of the coziest places I've stayed at. We'll definitely be back, once we work on our budget!

Reviews.Title: “Can't fault this hotel.”
Reviews.Author: gordie 123
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 4 nights between Christmas and New Year and could not fault hotel in any way. Location is first class. Flew to CDG airport took Rossybus connection direct to Opera which is 5 minutes walk to hotel. Located in quiet street it is idealy located for walking to main attractions with Metro and Gare St. Lazare handy to get further a field. Plenty of cafe/bar/restuarants nearby. Room in hotel was not spacious but bigger than average city centre hotel, spotlessly clean, controlable air con/heating. We had breakfast included which offered good choice of fruit,cereal,breads pastries etc maybe not worth the 15 euros but eating out is expensive in Paris! Hotel staff were all pleasant and helpful. We would recommend highly and we would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Find”
Reviews.Author: Cymroardaith
Reviews.Content: Very well located on a quiet street literally a couple of blocks from a number of metro stations and lines. The Madeleine, Opera and department shops are on your doorstep and it's a comfortable twenty minute stroll from many of Paris's main sights including the Louvre and Musee d'Orsay, Place de la Concorde, Sacre Cour and the Champs Elysees. Small hotel of some 38 rooms spread over two buildings which meet at the reception / lounge area. Room numberings a little confusing as a result of the two buildings and separate lifts and stairs. Made to feel very welcome on arrival and nothing was too much trouble for the front desk staff who showed a genuine interest in the welfare of guests - on arrival, during our stay and after checkout when we arrived to collect our bags to begin our journey home. Particularly impressed when my wallet (which I'd accidently left at reception) was delivered to my door before I realised I didn't have it! Had a complimentary upgrade to a Superior Room on the fifth floor and internal corridor which was large (for a traditional 3* property in central Paris). The room itself was very clean, tastefully decorated with a beamed ceiling and oh so peaceful! The air con was a bonus as were the windows which looked down onto the grass roofed breakfast room on the ground floor. Breakfast was included in our rate and the breakfast room was small and immaculate. It was self-service but had an impressive choice of items and perfectly adequate to begin the day. It isn't the Four Seasons and doesn't pretend it is. I'd be very happy happy to return and recommend this hotel to others who are looking for something other than a grand Paris hotel or a bland chain!

Reviews.Title: “Comes as advertised!”
Reviews.Author: Barratt
Reviews.Content: This small 3 star hotel in the heart of Paris is well located for the visitor. It sits within walking distance of most major attractions and Metro access is handy. Amenities are clean , comfortable and functional. We found this small inn met all our needs for 5 nights in Paris and we enjoyed some of the many resturants surrounding the hotel. All of the promises made in the Hotel Sydney Opera's promotional material were met and the hard working, courteous staff made our stay a pleasure.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient location & clean, but that's all!”
Reviews.Author: BlueMount-travellers
Reviews.Content: The location and cleanliness of this hotel as rated on Trip Advisor should have made it a good choice for our 6 night stay in Paris. Its location was excellent, (near Metro, Printemps, Galleries Lafayette, railway station, sightseeing bus etc) and the hotel was exceptionally clean. Daisy, the receptionist on arrival, was very friendly and welcoming and happy to assist in organising day trips etc. Some other reception staff were not so cheerful!! Now for the downside - air-conditioning. It was unusually hot in Paris during our stay in April 2007 and the hotel policy was "..we do not provide cooling at this time of year". Cooling could have been provided at the flick of a switch by the receptionist!. We requested this several times to no avail. So there were sleepless nights due to a hot room and not being able to leave the window open because of street noise from traffic and the pub opposite. The Best Western management obviously need to use common sense and review this policy!! Breakfast was always under the watchful and annoying eye of sour-faced staff, enough to turn you off your cereal and room temperature milk (yuk!!). Breakfast at a cafe nearby could have been a better solution but it came in our travel package. Would we stay there again? - NO thanks.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location”
Reviews.Author: Chrystianne
Reviews.Content: Comfortable, clean hotel in the Opera district. Personnel was extremely friendly and spoke English. There is a small elevator if needed. Breakfast was nice with fresh fruit, juices, pastries, boiled eggs if you like and more. Lots of restaurants around the area. Quiet with an excellent price for that location.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice little hotel”
Reviews.Author: Bubel
Reviews.Content: We spent a long romantic weekend in Paris and chose this hotel as there was a cheap deal online. It is in an excellent location, close to train station St.Lazare from where you can reach the Gare du Nord within 10 minutes (for Eurostar). The area is lovely with nice restaurants and within walking distance of the Louvre. The hotel is small, but charming and of a good standard. Staff were very friendly and the service in general was excellent. The room was small but perfectly formed. Vey clean and modern with flat screen TV and extremely goood water pressure in the bathroom. The only negative was that we were on the ground floor quite close to reception and breakfast room and could here noise. Also, the metro is running right underneath the hotel, which could disturb you on the ground floor, but train stop running around midnight. All in all a very nice hotel for a short stay if you don't stay on the ground floor!

Reviews.Title: “Good Location, Clean And Nice”
Reviews.Author: MariaMartins
Reviews.Content: I stay with a group of friends, 4 nights and it was very good. Paris is wonderful, Hotel Sidney Opera it's very near of metro, you have a good restaurantes near, very, very near Lafayette and Printemps and my tripple room in Hotel Sidney Opera it's large, clean, quite and confortable beds. Very nice staff, expresso in breakfast... When I come back to Paris, it's my choice.

HotelInfo.Address: 50 Rue des Mathurins | 8th Arr., 75008 Paris, France
